isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - EXTERNAL LEAKAGE - AIR INDUCTION SYSTEM

svcsubproc.title: General
svcsubproc.para: The most common cause of engine failure is dirt. Even though an air cleaner element itself is properly serviced per the Operation Manual, there are other areas in the induction system which must be maintained. The importance of pressure testing the air induction system cannot be emphasized enough with present-day high speed diesel engines. An air induction leak on the suction side, no matter how small, can cause and engine failure and must not be tolerated.
